A standard [[philosophy|philosophical]] definition says that wisdom consists of making the best use of [[propositional knowledge|knowledge]]. As with any decision, a wise decision may be made with incomplete [[information]]{{Citation needed|date=March 2007}}. The technical philosophical term for the opposite of wisdom is ''folly''.{{Citation needed|date=March 2007}}
     
In his ''[[Metaphysics (Aristotle)|Metaphysics]]'', [[Aristotle]] defines wisdom as knowledge of causes: ''why'' things exist in a particular fashion.
